item.title: Maggie add a quote by David McCullough
item.description:
"To me, history ought to be a source of pleasure. It isn't just part of our civic responsibility. To me, it's an enlargement of the experience of being alive, just the way literature or art or music is."
[<i>The Title Always Comes Last</i>; NEH 2003 Jefferson Lecturer interview profile]" -- David McCullough

item.title: Maggie add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Daphne Du Maurier
item.description: "Last night I dreamt I went to Manderley again." -- Daphne Du Maurier

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Writers are always selling somebody out." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "I know why we try to keep the dead alive: we try to keep them alive in order to keep them with us. I also know that if we are to live ourselves there comes a point at which we must relinquish the dead, let them go, keep them dead. " -- Joan Didion

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Time is the school in which we learn" -- Joan Didion

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Life changes in the instant. The ordinary instant." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "You have to pick the places you don't walk away from." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen
